snippet: The government reported growth for all of 2012 was 1.9 percent, figures that were worse than analysts expected.
abstract: Japan's economy remained mired in recession in 2012, shrinking 0.4 percent for third straight quarter of contraction; government reports growth for year was 1.9 percent, figures that were worse than analysts expected.
lead_paragraph: The government reported growth for all of 2012 was 1.9 percent, figures that were worse than analysts expected.

headline.seo: Japanese Economy Contracts and Remains in Recession
headline.main: Japanese Economy Shrinks and Remains in Recession
headline.print_headline: Japanese Economy Shrinks And Remains in Recession
